bitfield.description: Always read as 0. Writes have no affect.
RTL revision. Will vary depending on release.
00 = Force Idle (always acknowledges). 01 = No Idle Mode (never acknowledges). 10 = Smart-Idle Mode. 11 = Smart Idle with Wakeup.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Write 1 = Set event (debug). Read 0 = No event pending. Read 1 = Event pending.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = No (enabled) event pending. Read 1 = Event pending. Write 1 = Clear (raw) event.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Enable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = Interrupt disabled (masked). Read 1 = Interrupt enabled. Write 1 = Disable interrupt.
Wakeup generation for HW Pen event. 0 = Wakeup disabled. 1 = Wakeup enabled.
Enable DMA request FIFO 1. Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = DMA line disabled. Read 1 = DMA line enabled. Write 1 = Enable DMA line.
Enable DMA request FIFO 0. Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = DMA line disabled. Read 1 = DMA line enabled. Write 1 = Enable DMA line.
Disable DMA request FIFO 1. Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = DMA line disabled. Read 1 = DMA line enabled. Write 1 = Disable DMA line.
Disable DMA request FIFO 0. Write 0 = No action. Read 0 = DMA line disabled. Read 1 = DMA line enabled. Write 1 = Disable DMA line.
0 = SW steps are not pre-empted by HW events. 1 = SW steps are pre-empted by HW events
0 = Map HW event to Pen touch irq (from AFE). 1 = Map HW event to HW event input.
0 = Touchscreen transistors disabled. 1 = Touchscreen transistors enabled

These two bits are sent directly to the AFE Pen Ctrl inputs. Bit 6 controls the Wiper touch (5 wire modes)Bit 5 controls the X+ touch (4 wire modes)User also needs to make sure the ground path is connected properly for pen interrupt to occur (using the StepConfig registers)Refer to section 4 interrupts for more information
ADC Power Down control. 0 = AFE is powered up (default). 1 = Write 1 to power down AFE (the tsc_adc_ss enable (bit 0) should also be set to off)
Select Bias to AFE. 0 = Internal. 1 = Reserved.
0 = Step configuration registers are protected (not writable). 1 = Step configuration registers are not protected (writable).
Writing 1 to this bit will store the Step ID number with the captured ADC data in the FIFO. 0 = Write zeroes. 1 = Store the channel ID tag.

TSC_ADC_SS module enable bit. After programming all the steps and configuration registers, write a 1to this bit to turn on TSC_ADC_SS. Writing a 0 will disable the module (after the current conversion).
Status of OCP FSM and ADC FSM. 0 = Idle. 1 = Busy.

register.description: High and Low Range Threshold@TSC_ADC_SS_Range_Check Register

bitfield.description: Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. If the sampled data is greater than the value, then an interrupt is generated.
Sampled ADC data is compared to this value. If the sampled data is less than the value, then an interrupt is generated.
The input ADC clock will be divided by this value and sent to the AFE. Program to the value minus 1
Connected to AFE Spare Output pins. Reserved in normal operation.
Connected to AFE Spare Input pins. Reserved in normal operation.
Differential Control Pin. 0 = Single Ended. 1 = Differential Pair Enable.
SEL_RFM pins SW configuration. 00 = VSSA_ADC. 01 = XNUR. 10 = YNLR. 11 = VREFN.
SEL_INP pins SW configuration. 0000 = Channel 1. 0111 = Channel 8. 1xxx = VREFN.
SEL_INM pins for neg differential. 0000 = Channel 1. 0111 = Channel 8. 1xxx = VREFN.
SEL_RFP pins SW configuration. 000 = VDDA_ADC. 001 = XPUL. 010 = YPLL. 011 = VREFP. 1xx = Reserved.
Differential Control Pin. 0 = Single Ended. 1 = Differential Pair Enable.
SEL_RFM pins SW configuration. 00 = VSSA. 01 = XNUR. 10 = YNLR. 11 = VREFN.
SEL_INP pins SW configuration. 0000 = Channel 1. 0111 = Channel 8. 1xxx = VREFN.
SEL_INM pins for neg differential. 0000 = Channel 1. 0111 = Channel 8. 1xxx = VREFN.
SEL_RFP pins SW configuration. 000 = VDDA. 001 = XPUL. 010 = YPLL. 011 = VREFP. 1xx = INTREF.
Program the # of ADC clock cycles to wait between applying the step configuration registers and going back to the IDLE state. (Value must be greater than 0.)
0 = Disable out-of-range check. 1 = Compare ADC data with range check register.
Sampled data will be stored in FIFO. 0 = FIFO. 1 = FIFO 1.
Number of samplings to average: 000 = No average. 001 = 2 samples average. 010 = 4 samples average. 011 = 8 samples average. 100 = 16 samples average.
00 = SW enabled, one-shot. 01 = SW enabled, continuous. 10 = HW synchronized, one-shot. 11 = HW synchronized, continuous.
This register will control the number of ADC clock cycles to sample (hold SOC high). Any value programmed here will be added to the minimum requirement of 1 clock cycle.
Program the number of ADC clock cycles to wait after applying the step configuration registers and before sending the start of ADC conversion
0 = Disable out-of-range check. 1 = Compare ADC data with range check register.
Sampled data will be stored in FIFO. 0 = FIFO. 1 = FIFO1.

register.description: FIFO0 word count@TSC_ADC_SS_FIFO0 Word Count Register

bitfield.description: Number of words currently in the FIFO0

register.description: FIFO0 Threshold trigger@TSC_ADC_SS_FIFO0 Threshold Level Register

bitfield.description: Program the desired FIFO0 data sample level to reach before generating interrupt to CPU (program to value minus 1)

register.description: FIFO0 DMA req0 trigger@TSC_ADC_SS_FIFO0 DMA REQUEST Register

bitfield.description: Number of words in FIFO0 before generating a DMA request (program to value minus 1)

register.description: FIFO1 word count@TSC_ADC_SS_FIFO1 Word Count Register

bitfield.description: Number of words currently in the FIFO0

register.description: FIFO1 Threshold trigger@TSC_ADC_SS_FIFO1 Threshold Level Register

bitfield.description: Program the desired FIFO0 data sample level to reach before generating interrupt to CPU (program to value minus 1)

register.description: FIFO1 DMA req1 trigger@TSC_ADC_SS_FIFO1 DMA Request Register

bitfield.description: Number of words in FIFO0 before generating a DMA request (program to value minus 1)
Optional ID tag of channel that captured the data. If tag option is disabled, these bits will be 0.
12 bit sampled ADC converted data value stored in FIFO 0.
Optional ID tag of channel that captured the data. If tag option is disabled, these bits will be 0.
12 bit sampled ADC converted data value stored in FIFO 1.
